newsitem.title: UK: UK to use council home sale receipts for building.
newsitem.headline: UK to use council home sale receipts for building.

text.p: The new Labour government said on Wednesday it would introduce a bill to enable capital receipts from the sale of council houses to be invested in housebuilding and renovation.

The Queen's Speech, setting out Prime Minister Tony Blair's legislative programme for the next 18 months, said the move underscored the government's determination to deal with homeleness and unemployment.
The bill would amend the 1989 Local Government and Housing Act to allow the issue of appropriate credit approvals that take account of capital receipts set aside for the repayment of debt.

The previous Conservative government barred local authorities from spending about five billion pounds raised from the sale of council houses to their tenants -- one of the flagship policies of former prime minister Margaret Thatcher.
Labour has said it would release the money over five years and target it on areas of the country with the direst housing needs.
